Package ohos.multimodalinput.event

Class MultimodalEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.multimodalinput.event.MultimodalEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Sequenceable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CompositeEvent, KeyEvent, ManipulationEvent, RotationEvent, SpeechEvent

    public abstract class MultimodalEvent
extends Object
implements Sequenceable
    Represents the base class of all event types.

    This class defines a series of high-level event types that represent abstracted user behaviors or intents. In addition, it defines the methods and information shared by various child classes. If you only want to capture the abstracted behaviors in events, you just need to rewrite the callback interfaces defined in this class. If you want to obtain more information, then you can directly use the methods defined in this class. If the callback and event processing methods for abstracted events cannot meet your needs, you can also convert the events into more specific event types. For example, you can convert MultimodalEvent into KeyboardEvent, so as to obtain more detailed information or use a more direct and simple callback interface.

    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.MultimodalInput#MULTIMODAL_INPUT

      • highLevelEvent

        protected int highLevelEvent
        Indicates a high-level event. This field needs to be set only if the event of a class that extends MultimodalEvent can be converted to a high-level event.
        Since:
        1

      • uuid

        protected final UUID uuid
        Indicates a globally unique ID that helps distinguish one event from others. For details, see isSameEvent(java.util.UUID).

    • Method Detail

      • isSameEvent

        public boolean isSameEvent​(UUID id)
        Checks whether the current event is the same as the event with the specified UUID.
        Parameters:
        id - Specifies UUID of the event to be checked.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the current event is the same as the event with the specified UUID; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • getSourceDevice

        public abstract int getSourceDevice​()
        Obtains the type of the input device that generates the current event.
        Returns:
        Returns the type of the input device that generates the event. The return values are as follows: UNSUPPORTED_DEVICE: no input device. Generally, this is the default value. TOUCH_PANEL: touch panel KEYBOARD: keyboard MOUSE: mouse STYLUS: stylus BUILTIN_KEY: built-in key ROTATION: rotation component SPEECH: speech component
        Since:
        3

      • getDeviceId

        public abstract String getDeviceId​()
        Obtains the ID of the bearing device for the input device that generates the current event.

        For example, if two mouse devices are connected to the same device, this device is the bearing device of the two mouse devices.

        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the bearing device for the input device that generates the current event; returns null if there is no input device.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getInputDeviceId()

      • getInputDeviceId

        public abstract int getInputDeviceId​()
        Obtains the ID of the input device that generates the current event.

        An input device is identified by a unique ID. For example, when two mouse devices generate an event respectively, the device ID in the generated events are different. This allows your application to use the device ID to identify the actual input device.

        Returns:
        Returns the ID of the input device that generates the current event; returns -1 if there is no input device.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        getDeviceId()

      • getOccurredTime

        public abstract long getOccurredTime​()
        Obtains the time when the current event is generated.
        Returns:
        Returns the time (in ms) when the current event is generated.
        Since:
        1
